wikipedia_page.main: Jeremy Joseph Lopez (born 9 July 1989) is a Gibraltarian footballer who plays for Gibraltar National League side Bruno's Magpies and the Gibraltar national team, where he plays as a right winger.

response: He made his debut for the Gibraltar national football team aged 17 years and 264 days on 23 March 2016, starting in a goalless draw against Liechtenstein at the Victoria Stadium - making him the territory's youngest UEFA era player at the time until Dylan Borge broke his record in March 2021. His addition into a five-man defence by manager Jeff Wood allowed the formerly defensive Joseph Chipolina to attack. In the 69th-minute, shortly after being booked, Olivero was substituted for Jeremy Lopez. In October 2020, he was named captain for the first time, against Malta.Special football feature - Turning Pro – Jayce Olivero explains how it’s not just a dream but a reality Gibraltar Chronicle. 27 October 2020. Retrieved 14 November 2020.
